solution_line_template: If the average temperature of Orlando for the week was {avg_temp}, then the total temperature for the week was {days_in_week}*{avg_temp} = <<{days_in_week}*{avg_temp}={total_temp_week}>>{total_temp_week} degrees

For the first three days of that week, the temperature was {temp_first_three} degrees each day, totaling {first_three_days}*{temp_first_three} = <<{first_three_days}*{temp_first_three}={total_temp_first_three}>>{total_temp_first_three} degrees in the three days.

The temperature for Thursday and Friday was {temp_thurs_fri} degrees each, a total of {temp_thurs_fri}*{thurs_fri_days} = <<{temp_thurs_fri}*{thurs_fri_days}={total_temp_thurs_fri}>>{total_temp_thurs_fri} degrees.

The temperature of Orlando for the first five days was {total_temp_thurs_fri}+{total_temp_first_three} = <<{total_temp_thurs_fri}+{total_temp_first_three}={total_temp_first_five}>>{total_temp_first_five} degrees.
The temperature for the remaining two days is {total_temp_week}-{total_temp_first_five} = <<{total_temp_week}-{total_temp_first_five}={total_temp_remaining}>>{total_temp_remaining} degrees.
